body:
I'm building a docker container (from fedora:latest), setting up spack inside it and running
```bash
$ spack install gcc@4.8.5
```
Spack fails to install gcc, and fails with errors like this:
```
/home/nalu/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-4.8.5-ccusns5lwdiqigdb3fh64qk7kjowgjp5/gcc-4.8.5/libiberty/../include/libiberty.h:92:22: error: expected '=', ',', ';', 'asm' or '__attribute__' before 'PARAMS'
 extern int writeargv PARAMS ((char **, FILE *));
                      ^~~~~~
```
Here is the full output log:
[spack-build.txt](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/files/584855/spack-build.txt)


Trying to run the configure line explicitly

'--libdir=/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/gcc-4.8.5-ccusns5lwdiqigdb3fh64qk7kjowgjp5/lib64' '--disable-multilib' '--enable-languages=c,java,c++,fortran,objc,go' '--with-mpc=/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/mpc-1.0.3-yff53nnt4ci2z7ps5islaogkieagdzaw' '--with-mpfr=/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/mpfr-3.1.4-pmahifjapbfxmgqibng5uj5jpzvpzlaj' '--with-gmp=/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/gmp-6.1.1-jgkljtfxwn43ihlwpupnnm2ubc73x2t2' '--enable-lto' '--with-quad' '--with-sysroot=/' '--with-stage1-ldflags=-Wl,-rpath,/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/gcc-4.8.5-ccusns5lwdiqigdb3fh64qk7kjowgjp5/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/gcc-4.8.5-ccusns5lwdiqigdb3fh64qk7kjowgjp5/lib64 '--with-boot-ldflags=-Wl,-rpath,/home/nalu/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora24-x86_64/gcc-6.2.1/gcc-4.8.5-ccusns5lwdiqigdb3fh64qk7kjowgjp5/lib and then running `make` works.

The container's compiler is gcc-6.2.1. As an extra reference, I tried to workaround by first building gcc@5.1.0 (which worked) and then using that downgraded version to build gcc@4.8.5. However, it still failed with the same error.
title: Spack fails to compile an older version of gcc inside a container
